task.title: Simple Omelette
task.shortdesc: An easy, savory, fluffy, and delicious omelette for breakfast lovers. This omelette can be filled and topped with anything you like!

taskbody.prereq:
For this recipe you will need an oven-safe skillet, a rubber spatula, a food processor, and an oven mitt. Ingredients are as follows:
3/4 cups firm silken tofu, drained and gently patted dry
2 Tbsp Hummus
2 large garlic cloves, minced
2 Tbsp nutritional yeast
1/4 Tsp paprika
1 Tsp cornstarch
1 cup of veggies of choice
2 eggs
2 Tbsp water
1 Tsp butter
1 cup of veggies of choice
1/3 cup ham, finely chopped
1/3 cup shredded cheese

step.cmd: Beat eggs, water, salt and pepper in small bowl until blended
Heat butter in a small-to-medium, oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Tilt pan to coat bottom
Prep veggies, drain and dry tofu, and mince garlic. Set aside
Heat a small-to-medium, oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add olive oil and minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes or until just lightly golden brown

Transfer garlic to food processor, along with remaining omelet ingredients (tofu – cornstarch) and mix to combine, scraping down sides as needed. Add just a touch of water to thin – 1-2 Tbsp at most. Set aside
Add the veggies to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper and sauté to desired doneness
Pour in the omelette batter and cook over medium heat on the stove top for 5 minutes until the edges start to dry.

Place skillet in 375 degree oven and bake until dry and deep golden brown – 10-15 minutes. The longer it bakes the less soft/wet it will be, so if you prefer a more “well done” omelet, cook closer to 15 or more
Carefully remove from oven with oven mitt and fold over gently with a spatula. If it doesn’t want to fold, you can serve it as a frittata or scramble!
Serve with desired toppings and enjoy
step.stepresult: You should expect a full stomach after enjoying this wholesome omelette!
